property.name: description
property.value: Van Gogh Alive is just the kind of inspiring, imagination-expanding experience we're known for delivering to visitors

property.name: description
property.value: Nightgowns is a monthly live theatrical showcase dedicated to exceptional drag performance of all kinds! First created at Bizarre Bushwick, the show has now taken residency at National Sawdust in Williamsburg

property.name: description
property.value: The Museo del Prado and the Boijmans Van Beuningen Museum are presenting the exhibition Rubens. Painter of Sketches. Sponsored by Fundación AXA and with the collaboration of the Government of Flanders, it offers an analysis of Rubens as the most important painter of oil sketches in the history of European art.

property.name: description
property.value: The exhibition brings together a selection of nine paintings on monochrome stone (slate and white marble) by Italian painters such as Sebastiano del Piombo, Titian, Daniele da Volterra and Leandro Bassano.

property.name: description
property.value: The outstanding quality of the Óscar Alzaga Villaamil donation makes it a significant addition to the Museo Nacional del Prado’s collection.

property.name: title
property.value: Velázquez and the Celebration of Painting: the Golden Age in the Museo del Prado

property.name: description
property.value: Comprising 61 thematically organised paintings, the exhibition aims to offer Japanese visitors an exceptional opportunity to appreciate the art of Velázquez and to understand it in relation to the art of his Spanish and European contemporaries

property.name: description
property.value: This exhibition focuses on the friendship of the artists Niko Ghika and John Craxton, and the writer Patrick Leigh Fermor. Their shared love of Greece was fundamental to their work, as they embraced its sights, sounds, colours and people.

property.name: title
property.value: Christmas Tree and Neapolitan Baroque Crèche

property.name: description
property.value: The Museum continues a longstanding holiday tradition with the presentation of its Christmas tree, a favorite of Vaticans and visitors from around the world

property.name: title
property.value: France Viewed from the Grand Siècle Drawings by Israël Silvestre

property.name: description
property.value: While Silvestre's engravings circulated widely, his drawings remain relatively unknown. The Musée du Louvre is home to a remarkable collection of them, to be shown to the public for the first time.

property.name: description
property.value: Eugène Delacroix was one of the giants of French painting, but his last full retrospective exhibition in Paris dates back to 1963, the centenary year of his death. In collaboration with the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, the Louvre is holding a historic exhibition featuring some 180 works—mostly paintings—as a tribute to his entire career.

property.name: title
property.value: Art and China after 1989: Theater of the World

property.name: description
property.value: Art and China after 1989 presents work by some sixty key artists and groups active across China and worldwide whose critical provocations aim to forge reality free from ideology, to establish the individual apart from the collective, and to define contemporary Chinese experience in universal terms.

property.name: title
property.value: HERStory of the World: Pop Stars

property.name: description
property.value: From legendary icons such as Madonna and Diana Ross, to iconic legends of today as Lady Gaga or Lana Del Rey. This month, in Madame Tussauds, is dedicated to those girls who made an impact in pop culture.

property.name: title
property.value: The Credit Suisse Exhibition: Monet and Architecture

property.name: description
property.value: One exhibition featuring Monet’s paintings and nothing else? That’s a rare thing. The last time the UK hosted a Monet exhibition like this was almost 20 years ago. But 'Monet and Architecture' is not just rare, it’s never been done before.

property.name: description
property.value: BATIMAT EGYPT will offer the complete range of products and solutions suited to the construction market in Egypt and the Middle East.
